title: Latest News from Science Magazine
description: Keyword search result for Alerts: News Weekly Headlines -- New results matching your keyword search query (updated daily).

items.title: Silicon Valley bets on science—without strings
items.description: Billionaire-backed Episteme aims to free research from bureaucracy, but history shows reinventing science is hard

items.title: To reduce science’s carbon footprint, researchers in France reinvent work practices
items.description: Grassroots efforts explore what works—and where the tensions lie

items.title: CDC funds controversial hepatitis B vaccine trial in African newborns
items.description: Scientists question the value of the proposed study, which will investigate a vaccine long known to be efficacious and safe

items.title: <cite>Science</cite>’s 2025 Breakthrough of the Year: The unstoppable rise of renewable energy
items.description: Clean energy infrastructure is being deployed with unmatched scale and speed—and China is leading the way

items.title: Why are women more likely to get irritable bowel syndrome? New study provides clues
items.description: Cells in the guts of female mice respond to estrogen by increasing pain signaling, researchers find

items.title: Our favorite science news stories of 2025
items.description: A mix of <cite>Science</cite>’s most loved and most read items of the year

items.title: Trump administration moves to break up leading U.S. climate and weather center
items.description: White House budget director calls the National Center for Atmospheric Research a source of “climate alarmism”

items.title: Misconduct sleuth wins $2.63 million from major cancer institute in $15 million settlement
items.description: Data detectives see validation in deal with U.S. government that penalizes Dana-Farber Cancer Institute for misrepresenting data in NIH grant applications

items.title: New NASA administrator takes over after a year of scientific loss—and survival
items.description: Following Senate confirmation, billionaire Jared Isaacman will lead a diminished workforce

items.title: Ancient tectonic plates are oozing along Earth’s core
items.description: Thousands of earthquakes yield best picture yet of core-mantle boundary, shedding light on deep flows of viscous rock
